column1: Piroxicam is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain and swelling.
Piroxicam is also sold under the brand name Feldene.

Airways and lungs: - Rapid breathing - Slow, labored breathing - Wheezing Eyes, ears, nose, and throat: - Ringing in the ears - Blurred vision Nervous system: - Agitation - Coma - Confusion - Convulsions (seizures) - Drowsiness - Headache (severe) - Incoherence (not understandable) - Movement disorder - Unsteadiness Skin: - Rash Stomach and intestines: - Diarrhea - Heartburn - Nausea - Stomach pain (possible bleeding in the stomach and intestines) - Vomiting

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation), and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms
